docs.title: 👋 Welcome to PBbuddy!
docs.text:
Welcome to the official internal documentation hub for PB <> SME Processes — your go-to guide for everything related to operations, logic flows, and automations across sme.policybazaar.com.

⚠️ For Internal Use Only — Please do not share externally.

docs.title: 🧭 Broad Categories
docs.text:
Here’s a quick overview of what this documentation covers:

  • 🧩 Calling Understand how calling priorities are determined, PRB flows, lead callback logics, and agent assignments.

  • 🧠 Assignment Dive into logic behind assigning leads to agents based on performance, tenure, or customer history.

  • 📞 Dialer Priority Rules governing what gets prioritized in the dialer queue and how the fallback logic works.

  • 📋 Lead Management SOPs related to lead reopens, rejections, UTM source tagging, and referral logic.

  • 🛰️ Virtual Dial Learn about MatrixGo, WhatsApp flows, virtual number assignments, and recurring communication logic.

  • 📊 Sales View Insights, dashboards, and logic on how we measure PRB conversions, lead efficiency, and booking history.

  • 🎧 Inbound Flowcharts and rules related to inbound calling, TL verification, and callback assignments.

  • 📣 Comms Communication strategy including WhatsApp touchpoints, email journeys, and call pitch SOPs.

docs.title: 🛠 MkDocs Usage
docs.text:
For developers maintaining this documentation:

  • mkdocs serve — Start a local dev server with live reload
  • mkdocs build — Compile the static site into the site/ folder
  • mkdocs -h — Show all available CLI options

docs.title: 💬 Need Help?
docs.text: Ping the PBbuddy Dev Team - @HitanshuKapoor on Slack or raise an internal ITSM ticket with subject "PBbuddy Documentation Issue".

docs.title: 🧾 Overview
docs.text: This SOP defines the process for handling PRB-rejected leads, including identification, callback scheduling, lead assignment, and exclusions. It also incorporates guidelines for V2 enhancements and dynamic lead management.

docs.title: 👤 Customer Identification
docs.text:
• From the go-live date 2025-04-01, all customers marked as PRB will be tracked.
  • Leads with the following exclusion criteria will not be considered:
  • PRB Lead Source: PRB
  • PRB UTM Source: PRB_Rejected

docs.title: 📆 Callback Process
docs.text:
• The job runs at 23:00 every night.
  • Callback setting starts at 23:30.
  • Callbacks will be scheduled every 9 minutes for agents with multiple PRB callbacks.

docs.title: 🚫 Exclusions
docs.text:
• For leads dated between 1st and 15th of any month:
  • Booked leads, callbacks, or those with ≥ 180 seconds talk time will be excluded from PRB creation.

docs.title: ❌ Rejected Lead Handling
docs.text:
• Unassigned: No action taken.
  • Assigned: Rejected lead is reassigned to the last assigned agent.

docs.title: 🔁 Callback on Parent Lead
docs.text:
• For active Marine leads of the client:
  • Set callback on the open parent lead.
  • No new leads created.
  • Callback Message Display: PRB Callback

docs.title: ☎️ Dialer & Prioritization
docs.text:
• If a callback is not scheduled, it won't be prioritized in the dialer.
  • Max 3 consecutive callbacks per lead.

docs.title: 🧾 Lead Creation & Rejection
docs.text:
• No new PRB lead creation if the source or UTM matches rejection criteria.
  • Rejected leads will not be counted toward 1000.

docs.title: ⏰ Callback Schedule
docs.text:
• Callback Time Window: 15:00 to 16:30
  • Callback Frequency: Every 15 minutes

docs.title: 👥 Lead Assignment
docs.text:
• Leads assigned only to agents tagged with PRB.
  • Agent selection based on:
  • Agent with max bookings on the Customer ID.
  • If no agents available: Assign to any agent with 6+ months in Marine ST group.

docs.title: 🛑 Dialing Rejection Logic
docs.text:
• First day dial from system.
  • Post-first-day, only manual dials allowed.
  • System will not include in auto dialer priority.

docs.title: 🌙 Cool-Off Period
docs.text: • Cool-off period: 15 days from last callback for the same lead.

docs.title: ❓ Open Questions
docs.text:
• If callbacks exceed 6 → What is the fallback process?

  • Action needed: Prevent further callbacks or reroute to a senior agent?

  • Job Rejection Logic for Callback Feature:

  • SOP pending to define actions when rejection logic is triggered due to thresholds.

docs.title: 📊 Insights
docs.text:
• Rejected PRB Leads:
  • Low conversion rates → Recommend monthly outreach.
  • Booked PRB Leads:
  • High conversion → Continue prioritizing at scheduled CB time.
  • Manual call option remains enabled for agents.

docs.title: ✅ Action Items
docs.text:
• Auto-Reopen Rejected PRB: Every 30 days.
  • Referral/Upsell PRB Tagging:
  • All non-AO customers with > 3 policies tagged as PRB.

  • Reopened every 30 days.

  • Unmark as PRB Option:

  • Agents can unmark PRB via rejection disposition: Unmark PRB

  • HH Occupancy Exclusion:

  • Prevent HH occupancy from being auto-tagged as PRB.

  • Call Audits:

  • Enable audit request process for PRB leads.

  • PRB Communication:

  • WhatsApp comms monthly via MatrixGo.
  • New messaging every time.

docs.title: 🧠 Arpita’s Observations
docs.text:
• Customers with > 3 policies (non-AO) tagged as PRB.
  • No year-round comms once AO is bought.
  • Monthly callback by system every 2 months.
  • Use MatrixGo Virtual Number: MatrixGo.
  • Agent assignment based on:
  • Highest sales count.
  • TL verification if needed.

docs.title: Lead Management & Communication SOP 🚀
docs.text: This document details the strategies and processes for lead allocation, dialing, inbound call handling, lead creation, and various communication channels across different product lines.

docs.title: Core Leads
docs.text:
• Below 50 Lives: Assigned to the High APE Team.
  • 200 & Above 200 Lives: Assigned to the Online Hybrid Team.
  • Note: All leads from the core channel with 0 lives are now also assigned to the High APE Team.

docs.title: Non-Core Leads
docs.text: • All non-core leads are assigned to the High APE Team.

docs.title: Mobile App Allocation 📱
docs.text:
• If the customer selects "Company" as input, the lead is assigned to the High APE Team.
  • If the customer selects "Individual", the lead is assigned to the SME HOC Team.

docs.title: Winback Allocation 🔄
docs.text:
• Strategy: Leads are generally assigned to the agents who previously worked on those cases.
  • Winback Types:
    • LYLR (Last Year Lapsed Renewal)
    • LYLIR (Last Year Lapsed Intermediate Renewal)
    • LYLCR (Last Year Lapsed Canceled Renewal)
  • LYLR Specifics: Most LYLR allocations are now directed to fresh agents. However, a few leads are still assigned to renewal agents if they were the last agents to work on those cases prior to this allocation.

docs.title: 2. Assignment TAT ⏱️
docs.text: • Leads are assigned within 5 minutes of their creation.

docs.title: Generic
docs.text:
• Working Hours: 09:00 to 18:00 (Last lead assignment time: 17:30)
  • Non-Working Hours: 18:01 to 08:59
  • Lead Age: If a lead has a status of "New" or "Valid" and no contact has been made within the next 7 days, the system will automatically mark the lead as "Rejected."
  • Future Prospect:
    • If the talk time on a particular lead is 10 minutes, the agent cannot mark the lead as a "Future Prospect."
    • If a lead in Sub-product A is rejected as a "Future Prospect" and the user (at the customer ID level) purchases any sub-product across SME before the specified date, no lead will be created on that specific date.
    • The minimum start date for a "Future Prospect" is D+30 days.

docs.title: Winback Logic 🔙
docs.text:
• WC Expired Leads: Created before 90 days of policy expiry.
  • PI Last Year Lost Cases/Renewal: Created before 60 days of policy expiry.
  • Marine Winback: For last year's lost renewals.
  • Liability Winback: For last year's lost renewals.

docs.title: Lead (Call) Status 📊
docs.text:
These statuses are system-assigned, but the agent can change the status from the UI. Additionally, if the status is changed from "Valid" to "Interested," it cannot be reverted to "Valid" by either the user or the system.

  • New: A new lead in the system. If a user creates a new child ID while having an existing parent lead with a status other than "New," the child ID will be marked as "New," but the call will always be initiated on the parent ID. After booking, the status of the call will be marked as "Parent/Child Booked."
  • Valid: The customer didn’t pick up the call (i.e., there is a ring time available), or the number was switched off, or the call duration was less than 10 seconds.
  • Interested: Call duration is 15 seconds or more.
  • Contacted: Call duration is between 11 seconds and 14 minutes.

docs.title: Call Transfer Flow ➡️
docs.text: • Click on the transfer icon. After that, we will ask for the transfer type and sub-product type, and then the panel will be displayed. However, the panel should patch to the first available agent rather than the previous one.

docs.title: Lead Treatment 🔄
docs.text:
• First, reject the initial lead with the disposition "Interested in Other LOB" and create a new lead with the lead source from the initial lead.
  • Assignment: The new lead should be assigned to the first available agent, with selection available accordingly.

docs.title: Dialer Priority ⬆️
docs.text: • Dialer with explanation.

docs.title: Rejection Logic ❌
docs.text: Subproduct ID Subproduct Name New / Valid Contacted Interested M001 Marine Insurance At 5 attempts At 3 attempts After 2 attempts WC001 Workmen compensation At 5 attempts At 3 attempts After 2 attempts FB001 Fire and Burglary At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts SO001 Shop owner Insurance At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts OP001 Office package Policy At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts CAR01 Construction all Risk At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts EAR01 Erection All risk At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts PM001 Plant and Machinery At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts GL001 General Liability At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts DO001 D&O At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts EO001 E&O At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts GHI01 GHI At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts GPA01 GPA At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts OPD360 OPD care 360 At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts PI001 PI At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts PL001 Public Liability At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts CR001 Cyber Risk Insurance At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts PM002 Plant and Machinery At 5 attempts At 3 attempts At 2 attempts

docs.title: New Lead Calling Flow 🆕
docs.text: • All leads can get dialed max 10 times in a week.

docs.title: Calculation of Active Days 🗓️
docs.text: • Active Days Count: Only the days when the agent is actively working will be considered. If the agent is not active on a particular day (e.g., on leave or off), that day will not be counted in the scheduling logic.

docs.title: Call Schedule for Unconnected Leads ⏳
docs.text:
If a lead has not been contacted yet, the following call schedule will be followed:

  • Day 1: 4 Calls: The lead should receive a total of 4 calls on the first day.
    • 2 Calls in one shift (e.g., morning shift).
    • 2 Calls in another shift (e.g., evening shift).
  • Day 2: 2 Calls: The lead should receive 2 calls, scheduled in shifts different from those on Day 1. For example, if calls on Day 1 were in the morning and evening, the calls on Day 2 might be scheduled in the afternoon and late evening.
  • Day 3: 1 Call: The lead should receive 1 call on this day.
  • Day 5: 1 Call: Another 1 call should be made on this day.
  • Day 7: 1 Call: The final call in this sequence should be made on this day.

Important Notes:

  • Application of Call Flow: This call schedule is applicable only if none of the calls have been connected with the lead. In other words, if the lead has not answered any of the calls or if the calls went unanswered.
  • Connected Calls: If a call is connected (i.e., the lead answers the call), the scheduling and prioritization of further calls will follow a different set of rules or logic, which should be specified in your system's guidelines.

This flow ensures systematic and regular attempts to contact the lead, adjusting for agent availability and prioritizing connected calls based on established rules.

docs.title: Nullify First Attempt 🚫
docs.text: • Condition: The last attempt will be nullified if the customer revisits (via Revisit, Inbound, or Email) between the first and second attempt.

docs.title: Revisit Criteria 🔙
docs.text:
• Time Difference: A revisit will only be considered if the time between the last visit and the current visit is greater than 30 minutes.
  • During Call: A revisit during a call will be considered a revisit.
  • Website Revisit: If the customer revisits the PB website within 5 minutes, it will be treated as if the revisit did not occur.

docs.title: Active Callback 🔄
docs.text:
• Time Frame: All scheduled callbacks within CB-15 minutes to CB+15 minutes fall under this category.
  • Sorting: Internal sorting will be based on the difference between the current time and the callback time. The nearest callbacks will have higher priority.
  • Handling: If not attempted, the lead will be moved to the ‘Passive Callback’ bucket.

docs.title: Scenarios 🧩
docs.text:
• Scenario 1a: Picked (1st Attempt)
    • Actions: The agent can either: Book the lead or set up a callback.
    • If neither action is taken, the lead will move to the Rest/Answered Bucket.
  • Scenario 1b: Not Attempted/Not Answered/Not Connected (1st Attempt)
    • Handling: The lead will be moved out of the queue for 60 minutes and will reappear after 60 minutes according to the prioritization logic.
  • Scenario 1c: Picked (2nd Attempt) Where 1st Attempt Was Unanswered
    • Actions: The agent can either: Book the lead or set up a callback.
    • If neither action is taken, the lead will move to the Rest/Answered Bucket.
  • Scenario 1d: Not Attempted/Not Answered/Not Connected (2nd Attempt)
    • Handling: The lead will be moved to the Rest/Answered Bucket.

docs.title: Current Flow
docs.text:
• Main IVR:
    • 1: Group Health Insurance, Group Personal Accident Insurance, Group Term Life
      • Sub-IVR: "For Group Health Insurance, press 1. For Group Personal Accident Insurance, press 2. For Group Term Life Insurance, press 3."
    • 2: Workmen's Compensation
      • Queue: WC_Queue
      • Message: "For Workmen's Compensation Insurance, please press 1."
    • 3: Fire Insurance
      • Queue: Fire_Queue
      • Message: "For Fire Insurance for your business, please press 1."
    • 4: Marine Insurance
      • Queue: Marine_Queue
      • Message: "For Marine Insurance to secure your transit, please press 1."
    • 5: Doctor's Indemnity
      • Queue: DocIndem_Queue
      • Message: "For Doctor's Indemnity Insurance, please press 1."
    • 6: Liability Insurance
      • Queue: Liability_Queue
      • Message: "For any kind of business Liability Insurance, please press 1."
      • Sub-IVR:
        • "For General Liability Insurance, press 1."
        • "For Directors & Officers Insurance, press 2."
        • "For Cyber Risk Insurance, press 3."
        • "For any other professional indemnity (other than doctor), press 4." (Will land in the indemnity queue.)
    • 7: Engineering Insurance
      • Queue: Eng_Queue
      • Message: "For Construction Insurance, please press 1."
    • 8: Policy Renewal Related
    • 9: If you have not received a policy copy or have service-related issues
      • Queue: General_Queue
      • Message: "For any other service-related inquiries or to receive a policy copy, please press 1."

docs.title: Additional Information:
docs.text:
• Lead Creation: A lead will be created without a sub-product only when a call is received on the sales IVR.
  • Central IVR Flow: The central IVR will play the message and direct to the SME hotline for the same user experience.
    • Message: “For any type of business insurance, please press 5.”

docs.title: Renewal  renewals
docs.text:
• For CC: Before 90 days of the expiry date.
  • For FOS: Before 60 days of the expiry date.

docs.title: Winback
docs.text:
• Expired:
    • WC, CAR, EAR & CPM: Before 180 days from the Date of Expiry (DOE).
    • LYLR: Last year's lost renewal: 30 days before the expiry.
    • LYLIR: Last year's lost interest rejected: 45 days before the expiry.
    • LYLCR: Last year's lost contacted rejected: 60 days before the expiry.
  • Core Rejected: 90 days after the rejection date.
  • Own Rejected Winback (WB): 120 days after the rejection date.

docs.title: Manual Attempts Rules 📝
docs.text:
• If historical talk time (TT) < 2 min and same day TT = 0 and there are 3 unanswered attempts (UA), the advisor cannot release the call and dial manually.
  • Maximum 2 manual attempts allowed in a day if same day talk time < 1 minutes.
  • Maximum 5 manual attempts allowed in a day if same day talk time > 1 minutes.
  • If total talk time on Leadid is less than 1 minute, manual attempts are not allowed and the system will dial according to its priority.

docs.title: Burst Calling Rule 📈
docs.text:
• At customer level, if more than 5 unanswered attempts occur in 10 minutes, no calls are allowed to that customer for the next 24 hours.
  • Exceptions include: Paymentcallback, Callback (set before Burst calling), CTC, IB and Revisit allowed.
  • If same-day talk time > 5 minutes, manual calls are allowed.

docs.title: AI <> Calling - Status Stamping 🤖💬
docs.text:
• In Brief: If we receive any negative sentiment from the customer (Cx), we apply a cool-off period of 1 day.
  • On the second negative sentiment, the cool-off period extends to 3 days.
  • On the third negative sentiment, the Cx is unsubscribed for 7 days.
  • If, during this period, the Cx revisits our journey and opts to resubscribe, they will be subscribed again.
  • If they do not take any action, they will be automatically resubscribed after 30 days.
  • On rejection, we pass an identifier in the sub-status.

docs.title: Virtual Numbers 🌐
docs.text:
• After 3 attempts, the agent can dial using virtual numbers, which have strong connectivity.
  • We have enabled approximately 100 virtual numbers across various Lines of Business (LoBs).

docs.title: Tracker
docs.text: • Link: [Communication Tracker]

docs.title: System Communication Channels 📲
docs.text:
• WhatsApp
    • Generic Communication: On lead rejection (manual or system-driven), a generic message is sent for all sub-products.
    • If the customer (Cx) clicks the provided button, the system reopens the lead and assigns it to the last assigned agent.
    • Unanswered Attempts: For selected products like D&O, PI, an Unanswered Attempts message is sent.
    • For other products, this feature is in queue for implementation.
  • PRB Communication (Potential Repeat Buyer - PRB SOP)
    • First Communication: Before scheduling a callback, the system provides an option to schedule calls earlier.
    • This includes educational videos highlighting the risks of lack of insurance.
    • This initiative is applied across all products, starting with PI.
    • Video Link: https://example.com/prb_video
  • Email Communication: CJ has an email campaign plan, but there is no current drop campaign for emails.

docs.title: Manual Communication Channels ✍️
docs.text:
• WhatsApp
    • Advisor Channel: Advisors have access to free text messaging for communication.
    • Currently live for WC and Marine products.
    • Main Channel: Only template-based communication is allowed.
    • Live for all non-EB products, except Cyber Retail and Property products.
    • Calendar blocking templates are enabled for these exceptions.
    • Sales journey includes:
      • Greeting
      • Quote requirement questions
      • Proposal form sharing
      • Payment link sharing
      • Thank-you message
  • Email Templates
    • Generic Templates:
      • CJ Link
      • PB Meet Link
      • Payment Link
      • Blank Template
  • PB Meet
    • PB Meet functionality is currently available for GHI.
    • No non-EB product is using this feature yet.
    • PB Meet is a recorded video call (VC) system.
    • The agent can send a link and request the customer to connect over PB Meet.
  • Matrix GoSME flow
  • Field Advisor flow
  • Outreach Process
    • Calling of purchase database
    • Calling Mode: SIM panel calling
  • HOC Process
    • Implemented for Health, Motor, and Commercial products.
    • For Term and Investment, it is currently in queue.

docs.title: Lead Sourcing 💡
docs.text:
• Sales
  • Service
  • Employee Referrals

docs.title: Allocation Percentage Group
docs.text: The allocation percentage sharing for the WC group is as follows: 50, 30, and 20 percent.

docs.title: Adhoc Leads
docs.text:
• If leads are created under the annual open category (from CJ), they are assigned only to advisors with at least 6 months of total experience.
  • For single transit leads, assignments are made on a round-robin basis, following a Last In, First Out (LIFO) approach.

docs.title: Lead Assignment
docs.text:
• Single transit leads are assigned to the logged-in advisor on a round-robin basis.
  • Annual open leads are assigned to advisors with more than 6 months of tenure in the system.

docs.title: Agent Reassignment Logic 🔄
docs.text:
If a lead is created and assigned to an agent, and the lead has a talk time of 1 minutes, then:

  • If the assigned agent is unavailable for a particular day (e.g., on leave or a week off), the lead is reassigned to another available agent.
  • Once the original agent returns, the lead is reassigned back to them.
  • However, if the call duration between the new agent and the customer exceeds the call duration between the original agent and the customer, the lead remains with the new agent.

docs.title: Assignment TAT ⏱️
docs.text: • 15 minutes after lead creation.

docs.title: Qualification ✅
docs.text:
• Pmax: Quotes page landed.
  • YouTube: Quotes page landed.

docs.title: Offline Advertisement 📺
docs.text: • Toll-Free Number on Auto and Trucks: Leads are assigned directly to the “Marine Insurance” group. If no advisor is available, such calls are directed to the Saleib group.

docs.title: Lead Assignment
docs.text: • Leads are assigned on a round-robin basis to the logged-in advisor, following a LIFO approach.

docs.title: Winback Leads 🔙
docs.text:
• For Winback leads, the system first checks if the agent who previously booked the policy is active. If available, the lead is assigned to that agent.
  • If the previous agent is not active, the lead is assigned to available agents on a round-robin basis, provided they have more than 6 months of experience.
  • These leads do not count towards the daily limit.

docs.title: Qualification ✅
docs.text:
• Pmax WC: On quotes page landed.
  • Demand Gen WC: On quotes page landed.
  • Mobile App: Round-robin basis.

docs.title: Assignment TAT ⏱️
docs.text: • 3 minutes after lead creation.

docs.title: Lead Assignment
docs.text:
• If a PI lead comes from the Mobile App, the lead is only assigned if the user has selected ‘Call Now,’ edited the specialization, or clicked on the Premium option.
  • From 2025-05-19, all leads from the Mobile App are assigned.
  • Influencer campaign: All leads are assigned to the team.

docs.title: Assignment TAT ⏱️
docs.text: • 3 minutes after lead creation.

docs.title: Qualification ✅
docs.text: • Mobile App Leads: Assigned if either the plan ID is selected, ‘Call Us’ tile is clicked, or ‘Edit SI’ is clicked.

docs.title: Lead Assignment
docs.text: • Leads are assigned on a round-robin basis to the logged-in advisor, following a LIFO approach.

docs.title: Assignment TAT ⏱️
docs.text: • 3 minutes after lead creation.

docs.title: Cyber Individual Insurance 💻
docs.text:
• Individual cyber leads will not be assigned.
  • From 2024-02-20, all leads are assigned to one agent.

docs.title: Lead Assignment
docs.text: • Leads are assigned on a round-robin basis to the logged-in advisor, following a LIFO approach.

docs.title: Assignment TAT ⏱️
docs.text: • 3 minutes after lead creation.

docs.title: Qualification ✅
docs.text: • CPM: If RTO option is selected on CJ, such leads will not be assigned.

docs.title: Office Package Policy (7)
docs.text: • Any lead with sub-product ID 7 is assigned to Group ID 1302 on a round-robin basis.

docs.title: Fire & Burglary Insurance (5) 🔥
docs.text: • Any lead with sub-product ID 5 is redirected to Group ID 1296.

docs.title: Shop Owner Insurance (8) 🛍️
docs.text:
• Any lead with sub-product ID 8 is assigned to Group ID 1305 on a round-robin basis.
  • Any lead with sub-product ID 5 and occupancy ID in ('3135', '3253') is assigned to Group ID 1305 on a round-robin basis.

docs.title: Lead Assignment
docs.text: • Leads are assigned to the logged-in advisor on a round-robin basis, following a LIFO approach.

docs.title: Assignment TAT ⏱️
docs.text: • 3 minutes after lead creation.

docs.title: Offline Advertisement 📰
docs.text: • Toll-Free Number on Pamphlet: Leads are assigned directly to the Shop Owner Insurance group. If no advisor is available, such calls are directed to the Saleib group.

docs.title: Working Hours ⏰
docs.text: • 09:00 to 18:00 (Last lead assignment time: 17:30)

docs.title: Non-Working Hours 🌙
docs.text: • 18:01 to 08:59

docs.title: Lead Age ⏳
docs.text: • If a lead has a status of "New" or "Valid" and no contact has been made within the next 60 days, the system automatically marks the lead as "Rejected."

docs.title: Future Prospect 🔮
docs.text:
• If the talk time on a particular lead is 0 minutes, the agent cannot mark the lead as a "Future Prospect."
  • If a lead in Sub-product A is rejected as a "Future Prospect" and the user (at the customer ID level) purchases any sub-product across SME before the specified date, no lead will be created on that specific date.
  • The minimum start date for a "Future Prospect" is D+30 days.

docs.title: Winback Logic 🔄
docs.text:
• WC Expired Leads: Created before 15 days of policy expiry.
  • PI Last Year Lost Cases/Renewal: Created before 45 days of policy expiry.
  • Marine Winback: For last year's lost renewals.
  • Liability Winback: For last year's lost renewals.

docs.title: Lead (Call) Status 📞
docs.text:
• New: A new lead in the system. If a user creates a new child ID while having an existing parent lead with a status other than "New," the child ID will be marked as "New," but the call will always be initiated on the parent ID. After booking, the status of the call will be marked as "Parent/Child Booked."
  • Valid: The customer didn’t pick up the call (i.e., there is a ring time available), or the number was switched off, or the call duration was less than 10 seconds.
  • Interested: Call duration is 3 seconds or more.
  • Contacted: Call duration is between 10 seconds and 3 minutes.
  • These statuses are system-assigned, but the agent can change the status from the UI. Additionally, if the status is changed from "Valid" to "Interested," it cannot be reverted to "Valid" by either the user or the system.

docs.title: Call Transfer Flow ➡️
docs.text: • Click on the transfer icon. After that, we will ask for the transfer type and sub-product type, and then the panel will be displayed. However, the panel should patch to the first available agent rather than the previous one.

docs.title: Lead Treatment 🩹
docs.text:
• First, reject the initial lead with the disposition "Interested in Other LOB" and create a new lead with the lead source from the initial lead.
  • Assignment: The new lead should be assigned to the first available agent, with selection available accordingly.

docs.title: Rejection Logic ❌
docs.text: Subproduct ID Status (New/Valid) Status (Contacted) Status (Interested) Subproduct Name 13 At 9 attempts At 12 attempts After 24 attempts Marine Insurance 19 At 9 attempts At 12 attempts After 24 attempts Workmen compensation 5 At 6 attempts At 8 attempts At 16 attempts Fire and Burglary 7 At 6 attempts At 8 attempts At 16 attempts Shop owner Insurance 8 At 6 attempts At 8 attempts At 16 attempts Office package Policy 16 At 6 attempts At 8 attempts At 16 attempts Construction all Risk 17 At 6 attempts At 8 attempts At 16 attempts Erection All risk 19 At 6 attempts At 8 attempts At 16 attempts Plant and Machinery 12 At 9 attempts At 19 attempts At 36 attempts General Liability 15 At 9 attempts At 19 attempts At 36 attempts D&O 20 At 9 attempts At 19 attempts At 36 attempts E&O 1 At 9 attempts At 19 attempts At 36 attempts GHI 2 At 9 attempts At 19 attempts At 36 attempts GPA 25 At 9 attempts At 19 attempts At 36 attempts OPD care 360 14 At 9 attempts At 19 attempts At 36 attempts PI 24 At 9 attempts At 19 attempts At 36 attempts Public Liability 21 At 9 attempts At 19 attempts At 36 attempts Cyber Risk Insurance 18 At 6 attempts At 8 attempts At 16 attempts Plant and Machinery

docs.title: New Lead Calling Flow 📞
docs.text: • All leads can be dialed max 4 times in a week.

docs.title: Calculation of Active Days 🗓️
docs.text: • Active Days Count: Only the days when the agent is actively working will be considered. If the agent is not active on a particular day (e.g., on leave or off), that day will not be counted in the scheduling logic.

docs.title: Call Schedule for Unconnected Leads 📆
docs.text:
If a lead has not been contacted yet, the following call schedule will be followed:

  • Day 1:
    • 4 Calls: The lead should receive a total of 4 calls on the first day.
    • 2 Calls in one shift (e.g., morning shift).
    • 2 Calls in another shift (e.g., evening shift).
  • Day 2:
    • 2 Calls: The lead should receive 2 calls, scheduled in shifts different from those on Day 1.
  • Day 3:
    • 1 Call: The lead should receive 1 call on this day.
  • Day 5:
    • 1 Call: Another 1 call should be made on this day.
  • Day 7:
    • 1 Call: The final call in this sequence should be made on this day.

docs.title: Important Notes 📝
docs.text:
• Application of Call Flow: This call schedule is applicable only if none of the calls have been connected with the lead.
  • Connected Calls: If a call is connected, the scheduling and prioritization of further calls will follow a different set of rules.

docs.title: Nullify First Attempt 🚫
docs.text: • Condition: The last attempt will be nullified if the customer revisits (via Revisit, Inbound, or Email) between the first and second attempt.

docs.title: Revisit Criteria 🔙
docs.text:
• Time Difference: A revisit will only be considered if the time between the last visit and the current visit is greater than 15 minutes.
  • During Call: A revisit during a call will be considered a revisit.
  • Website Revisit: If the customer revisits the PB website within 60 minutes, it will be treated as if the revisit did not occur.

docs.title: Active Callback 🟢
docs.text:
• Time Frame: All scheduled callbacks within CB-15 minutes to CB+15 minutes fall under this category.
  • Sorting: Internal sorting will be based on the difference between the current time and the callback time. The nearest callbacks will have higher priority.
  • Handling: If not attempted, the lead will be moved to the ‘Passive Callback’ bucket.

docs.title: Scenario 1a: Picked (1st Attempt) ✅
docs.text:
• Actions: The agent can either:
    • Book the lead or set up a callback.
    • If neither action is taken, the lead will move to the Rest/Answered Bucket.

docs.title: Scenario 1b: Not Attempted/Not Answered/Not Connected (1st Attempt) 🔴
docs.text: • Handling: The lead will be moved out of the queue for 15 minutes and will reappear after 15 minutes according to the prioritization logic.

docs.title: Scenario 1c: Picked (2nd Attempt) Where 1st Attempt Was Unanswered ✅
docs.text:
• Actions: The agent can either:
    • Book the lead or set up a callback.
    • If neither action is taken, the lead will move to the Rest/Answered Bucket.

docs.title: Scenario 1d: Not Attempted/Not Answered/Not Connected (2nd Attempt) ❌
docs.text: • Handling: The lead will be moved to the Rest/Answered Bucket.

docs.title: Previous Flow
docs.text:
• Main IVR:
    • 1: GHI/GTL (1. GHI, 2. GPA, 3. GTL)
    • 2: Fire, WC, Marine, Liability & Engineering Insurance (1. Fire Insurance, 2. Workmen Compensation, 3. Marine Insurance, 4. Liability Insurance, 5. Engineering Insurance)
    • 3: If you have not received a policy copy
    • 4: Is it renewal related?
    • 5-9: Unassigned
    • 0: Unassigned

docs.title: Current Flow
docs.text:
• Main IVR:
    • 1: Group Health Insurance, Group Personal Accident Insurance, Group Term Life
      • Sub-IVR: "For Group Health Insurance, press 1. For Group Personal Accident Insurance, press 2. For Group Term Life Insurance, press 3."
    • 2: Workmen Compensation
      • Queue: sme_workmen_ib
      • Message: "For Workmen's Compensation Insurance, please press 2."
    • 3: Fire Insurance
      • Queue: sme_property_ib
      • Message: "For Fire Insurance for your business, please press 3."
    • 4: Marine Insurance
      • Queue: sme_marine_ib
      • Message: "For Marine Insurance to secure your transit, please press 4."
    • 5: Doctor's Indemnity
      • Queue: indemnity
      • Message: "For Doctor's Indemnity Insurance, please press 5."
    • 6: Liability Insurance
      • Queue: sme_liability_ib
      • Message: "For any kind of business Liability Insurance, please press 6."
      • Sub-IVR: "For General Liability Insurance, press 1." "For Directors & Officers Insurance, press 2." "For Cyber Risk Insurance, press 3." "For any other professional indemnity (other than doctor), press 4." (Will land in the indemnity queue.)
    • 7: Engineering Insurance
      • Queue: sme_engineering_ib
      • Message: "For Construction Insurance, please press 7."
    • 8: Policy Renewal Related
    • 9: If you have not received a policy copy or have service-related issues
      • Queue: bmsgeneral_queries
      • Message: "For any other service-related inquiries or to receive a policy copy, please press 9."

docs.title: Additional Information ℹ️
docs.text:
• Lead Creation: A lead will be created without a sub-product only when a call is received on the sales IVR.
  • Central IVR Flow: The central IVR will play the message and direct to the SME hotline for the same user experience.
  • Message: “For any type of business insurance, please press 7.”

docs.title: Renewal  renewals 🔄
docs.text:
• For CC: Before 60 days of the expiry date.
  • For FOS: Before 100 days of the expiry date.

docs.title: Winback 🏆
docs.text:
• Expired:
    • WC, CAR, EAR & CPM: Before {{ no such element: dict object['winback_expired_wccarearpm_days_from_doe'] }} days from the Date of Expiry (DOE).
    • LYLR: Last year's lost renewal: 15 days before the expiry.
    • LYLIR: Last year's lost interested rejected: 15 days before the expiry.
    • LYLCR: Last year's lost contacted rejected: 15 days before the expiry.
  • Core rejected: 45 days after the rejection date.
  • Own Rejected Winback (WB): 45 days after the rejection date.

docs.title: Manual Attempts rules 🖐️
docs.text:
• If historical talk time (TT) < 2 min and same day TT = 0 and there are 4 unanswered attempts (UA), the advisor cannot release the call and dial manually.
  • Maximum 2 manual attempts allowed in a day if same day talk time < 3 minutes.
  • Maximum 4 manual attempts allowed in a day if same day talk time > 3 minutes.
  • If total talk time on Leadid is less than 1 minute, manual attempts are not allowed and the system will dial according to its priority.

docs.title: Burst Calling rule 💥
docs.text:
• At customer level, if more than 5 unanswered attempts occur in 10 minutes, no calls are allowed to that customer for the next 24 hours.
  • Exceptions include: Paymentcallback, Callback (set before Burst calling), CTC, IB and Revisit allowed.
  • If same day talk time > 5 minutes, manual calls are allowed.

docs.title: AI<>Calling - Status Stamping 🤖📝
docs.text:
• If we receive any negative sentiment from the customer (Cx), we apply a cool-off period of 1 day.
  • On the second negative sentiment, the cool-off period extends to 3 days.
  • On the third negative sentiment, the Cx is unsubscribed for 30 days.
  • If, during this period, the Cx revisits our journey and opts to resubscribe, they will be subscribed again.
  • If they do not take any action, they will be automatically resubscribed after 30 days.
  • On rejection, we pass an identifier in the sub-status.

docs.title: Virtual Numbers 📞🌐
docs.text:
• After 2 attempts, the agent can dial using virtual numbers, which have strong connectivity.
  • We have enabled approximately 40 virtual numbers across various Lines of Business (LoBs).

docs.title: WhatsApp 🟢
docs.text:
• Generic Communication:
    • On lead rejection (manual or system-driven), a generic message is sent for all sub-products.
    • If the customer (Cx) clicks the provided button, the system reopens the lead and assigns it to the last assigned agent.
  • Unanswered Attempts:
    • For selected products like D&O, PI, an Unanswered Attempts message is sent.
    • For other products, this feature is in queue for implementation.
  • PRB Communication (Potential Repeat Buyer - PRB SOP):
    • First Communication: Before scheduling a callback, the system provides an option to schedule calls earlier. This includes educational videos highlighting the risks of lack of insurance. This initiative is applied across all products, starting with PI.
    • Video Link: https://example.com/prb_video

docs.title: Email Communication 📧
docs.text: • CJ has an email campaign plan, but there is no current drop campaign for emails.

docs.title: WhatsApp 💬
docs.text:
• Advisor Channel:
    • Advisors have access to free text messaging for communication.
    • Currently live for WC and Marine products.
  • Main Channel:
    • Only template-based communication is allowed.
    • Live for all non-EB products, except Cyber Retail and Property products.
    • Calendar blocking templates are enabled for these exceptions.
    • Sales journey includes: Greeting, Quote requirement questions, Proposal form sharing, Payment link sharing, Thank-you message.

docs.title: Email Templates 📄
docs.text: • Generic Templates: CJ Link, PB Meet Link, Payment Link, Blank Template.

docs.title: PB Meet 🤝
docs.text:
• PB Meet functionality is currently available for GHI.
  • No non-EB product is using this feature yet.
  • PB Meet is a recorded video call (VC) system. The agent can send a link and request the customer to connect over PB Meet.

docs.title: Outreach Process 📢
docs.text:
• Calling of purchase database
  • Calling Mode: SIM panel calling

docs.title: HOC Process 🏥
docs.text:
• Implemented for Health, Motor, and Commercial products.
  • For Term and Investment, it is currently in queue.

docs.title: Lead Sourcing 💡
docs.text:
• Sales
  • Service
  • Employee Referrals
